-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 1          |
-------------------------------


###You are walking home after a long day.
#There's no doubt, this hasn't been a nice day.
#You missed every possible bus and/or train.
#And it started raining,# too. #Of course, you do not have an umbrella with you.

#Looking up at the sky, it looks like all the clouds in the world just decided to gather right above your head,#
swallowing all of light and propagating dark vibes to the atmosphere and to the ground.

A $WLightning$C suddenly strikes, #not too far away!

##You shudder, stunned with its power.

##After few breathless seconds, #you breathe again 
and smell the ozone that was formed by the action of the electricity over the oxygen molecules.

##You realise you have to move fast if you don't want to end up way more soaked than you already are.



$D[Select with arrow keys and press enter]$C.

choices.desc: You start running. Let's minimise the water intake.
The water does not bother you that much. You are already soaked. So why rush?

chapters.text:
Speeding through the water, you feel the drops of rain smashing onto your face and body with unexpected strenght.
#You run even faster, trying to ignore the suffocating feeling of the water splashing down your face.
#
The wind howls between the unstopping, ever increasing noise of water hammering the asphalt.
#You feel your heart bouncing in your chest and hear your now accelerated breathing.
#
You are almost home, when you hear it.
#
$G<<...>>$C
###
Was it real? 
##For a split second you thought someone called on your name. It must have been all that noise...
#
#$G<<..ris..>>$C
###
It was clearer this time!

Resigned to your fate, you try to keep your head down,
trying to avoid being temporarily blinded by the water in your eyes.
#
The wind howls between the unstopping, ever increasing noise of water hammering the asphalt.
#
You also try to avoid the huge pools of water that are now forming on the road,
praying that no vehicle will rush over them splattering you with some nice mud.
#
You reach the bottom of the little hill that is in front of your house.
#You raise your eyes, and right when you are about to turn towards your gate, you see something.
#
On the top of the hill, there is something...# someone...# you can't say for sure.

choices.desc: You think you saw it wrong. Why waste time climbing the hill with this weather?
You decide to go and check. Someone could need help.

chapters.text:
You turn around, looking for the source of the voice.
#
It's hard to see something in the midst of this unexpected thunderstorm.
#You squint your eyes, fighting against the trickles of water that run into them.
#
After few seconds, you think you're seeing something.# On the top of the hill in front of your house.
#It looks like there is something... #someone...# there.
##But then you realise it's quite unlikely you could have heard your name called from that distance,
with all that noise.

choices.desc: You hate to stay more time under the rain... but... you never know?
You must have misheard. And if something's there, it's none of your business.

chapters.text:
You painstakingly reach the top of the hill, where a lonely big oak tree stands.
#It looks like nobody is here after all.
#
You are about to go back down, to the comfort of your home at last, when you hear it!
#
$G<<Chris!>>$C
#
You heard it right, you can't be wrong. It feels like the wind is calling your name to the rain...
#You feel a tingling sensation in the back of your neck,# somehow you $Wfeel$C someone's behind you.
#
#Then...## it all happen in an instant...##

The figure at the corner of your eye...
###The realisation that standing beneath a tree during a storm is not the safest option...
###The blinding light and the deafening boom suddenly engulfing you.
###
###Then...## only darkness.##

You are about to enter past your gate, to the comfort of your home at last, when you hear it!
#
$G<<Chris!>>$C
#
It feels like the wind is calling your name to the rain...
#It feels like the sound comes from behind your shoulders, but at the same time from afar.

#You feel a tingling sensation in the back of your neck,# somehow you $Wfeel$C someone's behind you.
#
#Then...## it all happen in an instant...##

The figure at the corner of your eye...
###The blinding light...
###The deafening boom suddenly engulfing you.
###
###Then...## only darkness.

-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 2          |
-------------------------------


$G<<You are alive...>>$C##

Whose is that voice?# Your own?# Have you actually heard it?#

You slowly open your eyes, as thoughts resume their flow in your mind, trying to re-establish contact with reality.
#
It takes several seconds to clear up your sight. You feel quite wrecked.
#Just breathing deeply is a pain. You painfully, slowly sit up, and look around.
#
You don't recognise what you see. You try hard to remember, and it finally gets back to you.
How can you still be alive after being hit by...# the lightning?
#By the way,# you are still soaked to the bone.

$c"Maybe I am dead,# afer all."#$C you say aloud, reconsidering the plausibility of that scenario.
#
In the meanwhile, you look at the small reddish vale that lies downhill.
#There is smoke ascending from what it looks like several fires or arsons.
#
You carefully stand up, getting dizzy until your sense of balance stabilises.
#

$D[When you see the prompt "\>", type an action you want to perform. Press TAB if you need help.]$C

$CThe first thing you notice is the sky, streaked with a cloud that looks like a jetstream of a plane.
#It has a strange, alien color.
#
The sun is setting, shedding its last light painting with odd glares the celestial vault,
which is already welcoming the faint sparkle of several stars.
#
A little downhill, you then notice an earth road going down towards the vale.
#It points in the direction of the fires.
#Looking more intently, you discern there must be some kind of village there.
#
It looks like there's nowhere else to go, at the moment.

You find your way downhill, following the earth path.

As you descend, the path gets narrower, meandering between an increasing number of trees.
#
Time passes, and night falls. Light recedes and you find yourself relying on the faint light of the stars.

As darkness takes hold, $rominous reddish glares$C paint the corners of the scene.
#You understand it's the light coming from the fires. You are getting closer.
#
The trees thin out and you can see the village entry a little further in front of you.

You won't waste time. You rush downhill flying over the earth road.

As you descend, the path gets narrower, meandering between an increasing number of trees.
#
This does not slow you down, nor the fact that running through the vegetation leaves
many marks on your skin, especially your arms and face.# You don't even realise it at the moment.

Time passes, and night falls. Light recedes and you find yourself relying on the faint light of the stars.

As darkness takes hold, $rominous reddish glares$C paint the corners of the scene.
#You understand it's the light coming from the fires. You are getting closer.
#
The trees thin out and you can see the village entry a little further in front of you.

You can't explain the reason of it to yourself, but for some reason, you start chuckling.
#Maybe it's the absurdity of the situation, or maybe it's a nervous reaction.
#
Anyway, you keep on laughing, louder and louder, until your voice becomes hysterical,
distorted, overlapped with its own echo.
##
After a while, you fell quite, the sound disperses around, and you feel some kind of sense of awkardness.

Your mind is rushing.
#$c<<What is this place?>>
#<<Am I dead?>>
#<<Am I in some hell?>>
#<<How do I get home?>>
#<<Is there anybody here?>>
#
$CAfter few moments, you burst out crying.# You weren't expecting it, but you can't help it.
#
After few minutes of what you classify as a pathetic scene, you feel better for some reason.

This is clearly impossible.# You must be dreaming.# Or maybe it's just some kind of sick prank.
#
Whatever it is, it's unacceptable. You feel your rage rising, supercharged by your pain and fear.
It soon becomes too much to hold inside, so you let out a mighty shout.
#
You scream at the space around you.
#To whoever might be listening.
#To your own fate.
#
You feel liberated.

You stand on this hill, like the one that is in front of your house.
#But the similarities end there. There are no places like this around your place,
maybe not even in your whole nation.
#
You are still wondering what happened and how did you end up here.
You try to keep calm, thinking about what to do next.

A small town lies in front of you.
#Or, to better say, what is left of it.
#
There is one main earth road that divides two main groups of houses, and little else.
Many buildings are in flames or already burnt to the ground.
Few others are seemingly intact.
#
There are no vehicles.
#No living soul is to be found around.
#

You keep on walking, and after few seconds you spot the first one.
##
$WA man.$C# Lying on his back, eyes wide open, staring into nothingness.
#An arrow stuck deep in his chest.# $WClearly dead.$C# Few flies buzzing around his mouth already.
##
You retch.

$c<<Where the heck am I...?# What is going on?# What am I supposed to do?>>$C you ask yourself when you feel better.
#
You keep on walking and realise the road is scattered with corpses.# Some kind of battle must have taken place...
#
You keep on walking, slowly, appalled.# You lose track of time, while your mind tries to grasp the reality.
#You cannot find an explanation to any of the things you are experiencing.


##After a while, you find yourself leaning on an empty doorframe of a house, which was somehow spared by the fire.
#
You shake up, shuddering. This reminds you that you should find some kind of shelter for the night,
#get dry,# and possibly not burnt.

choices.desc: You had enough for today. Nothing you may find inside the house could be worse than what is outside.
You just can't walk through that door, into the darkness...

chapters.text:
Overcoming fear with need, you enter the silent,# dark,# house.# You don't expect to find anybody in there.
#It's a very humble abode, earthen floor, small windows, few ornaments.
#
A fireplace signals the kitchen. A table, some chairs.# You suddenly realise how hungry you are.
#The only other room is the bedroom, a simple bed, a closet.
#All furniture pieces are made of the same wood.
#It doesn't look like there is running water anywhere. You can't even find a toilet.
#

$D[Usually, an action (verb) has to match an object (for example: $ddrink $Dthe $dwater$D)]$C

objects.answer: You find a loaf of bread, some unidentified fruit and some cheese.
There is covered jug full of water on the kitchen counter.
You find a pair of trousers, and a woolen shirt. They feel rough and old.

condition.refusal: I don't want to lay down with these dirty clothes on.

objects.answer: You remove your soaked clothes wearing what you just found.

condition.refusal: I need to find something to wear first.
I need to find some water.

actions.answer: You avidly drink the water, not caring about its taste.

condition.refusal: I need to find something to eat.

actions.answer: You devour what you just found.

chapters.text:
Driven away by the thought of what you could find inside that dark place, you resume your grim exploration.
#
The fires are almost out. Hostile embers spy on you from the corner of your eye.
#Not a sound, you feel and hear your own blood pumping in your veins.
##
You reach what looks like the center of that lost little town.
#There is a stone landmark in the middle of the square.
You feel a rush of gratitude when you discover it's a fountain.
#
You drink in a hurry, only now realising how thirsty you were.
#The water has a funny taste, but you are too overwhelmed to notice orterra calpestata care.
#You collapse on the ground, the most possible distant from any building,# fire,# or corpse.

...##

$G<<Wake up...>>$c##

"Who's calling...?"$C you mutter sitting up on the bed, fighting to regain full consciousness.
#You open your eyes, and you become freshly aware of the current situtation.
#It feel like a boulder has been thrown down on you,# again.
#
You don't know how long you've been asleep.# The sun must be high up already,
judging from the light that filters through the thick, dirty window.
#
You don't want to spend another minute in there, so you decide to hit the road.
#
Once outside, you hesitate just a moment, spectating the wasted scenario.
#Many other corpses you did not notice the night before, scavengers... You quickly turn your eyes away.
#
It looks like the fires are completely extinguished now.
The acrid smell of smoke is still all around you.
#You need to move. You start walking away, in the same direction as yesterday.

...##

$G<<Wake up...>>$c##

"Who's calling...?"$C you mutter, fighting to regain full consciousness.
#You open your eyes, and you become freshly aware of the current situtation.
#It feel like a boulder has been thrown down on you,# again.
#
You don't know how long you've been asleep.# The sun is already high.
#You slowly get back on your feet, aching after a night spent in an uncomfortable position.
You just hope you didn't get a cold or something worse having slept with your wet clothes out in the open.
#Luckily, wherever you are, the season is warm.
##
$c<<Wherever I am...>>$C You shake your head and start moving.
#You just resolutely decided you can't remain there for not even just a second.
There are many other corpses you did not notice the night before, scavengers... You quickly turn your eyes away.
#
It looks like the fires are completely extinguished now.
The acrid smell of smoke is still all around you.
#You quickly walk away, in the same direction as yesterday.

You are just leaving the last houses of the village behind,
when you notice something further away.#

When you are close enough, you see they are freshly dug graves.# A dozen, maybe.
#
All there's to see are just piles of earth. No tombstones. Only now nameless corpses.#

You look around, thinking about the fact that someone $Whad$C to be there to bury the bodies.
Obviously, they could not have dug those holes up and then taken turns in burying each other...$

You laugh at this thought.
#But then a shiver runs down your spine, wondering if that was what had actually happened.

You manage to get yourself distracted by studying the ground.
It looks trodden and loose, as if there was a quite big number of people not so long ago.
There are two distinctive, neat marks. They look like...
They look like the mark two wheels of a chariot would leave behind..!#

You follow them with your eyes, disappearing in the distance in front of you,
in an open, semi-desertic landscape.

You don't know where else to go, so you start following the trail.
Luckily, even a child could do that.

You walked all day long.# All you saw were little isolated trees, some bushes and some birds.
#You feel exhausted. It's almost sunset, and you are about to despair.#
But then, you see it. A thin plume of smoke rising.
#
$c<<Please not another dead town>>$C you say in your mind,# while you start walking faster.##

By the time you get there, it's completely dark. In front of you, an encampment.
#Your survival instinct tells you to lay down and crawl among the sparse low bushes and grass.

#There are many tents around a huge bonfire. Some men are roasting massive chunks of meat on it.
#The smell reaches you nostrils, and you almost faint: you had very little to eat in the last 48 hours.
#Around the fire, many men are dancing to the rhythm of crude songs with obscure words.
#Between a song and a piece of meat, they gulp down impressive mugs of what must be beer.

#You look around: no movement at the sides of the encampent. And then you see them.##

Slaves.# Women,# children.#
They are crammed inside several big cages on carriages,
which tracks you now realise you've been following the whole day.# Then it dawns on you:

#$c<<These thugs must be the responsibles of what I saw at that village!>>$C##

You think about the danger you put yourself in by following them,
but that feeling gets obscured by the disgust and rage.# You shouldn't, but you $Whave$C to do something.

choices.desc: You feel you must do something... But it's too dangerous, you don't want to end up in one of those cages.
You know it's a foolish idea, but you can't just leave them to their fate. You must help them.

chapters.text:
You sneak around, looking for anything you could use in order to survive another day, possibly more.#
You need to find supplies, and you want to understand who these people are exactly.#
You need to remain undetected.#

Luckily, it looks like there are no guards around. Everybody must be celebrating... # the...# victory?##
Thinking about this, disgust and rage fill you again.#
You take a deep breath to calm down.#

You proceed on resuming your exploration
when the entry of a tent right in front of you shakes as someone is getting out.#

dialogues.line: And who would you be...?
dialogues.comment:
You freeze.#
After few paralyzing istants, you manage to close your mouth, trying to dissimulate your fear.#

The voice belongs to a young woman; she is studying you intently, head tilted on one side.#

She is definitely attractive. She has black glinting eyes, long dark brown hair,
glowing $Rred$C under the light of the torches around.#
She's wearing a wide shirt, quite open on her cleavage.#
As for the rest, she's squeezed in a pair of black, thick, stitched leather leggings.
#Your eyes wonder maybe a little too long on the curve of her hips.#

Interesting posture, self confident... with such a delicious narrow waist...#

dialogues.line: Hey I asked you a question!
dialogues.comment:
With these words she snaps you out of your examining trance, smiling mischievously.#
You blush, while frantically trying to find something dignifying to say.#
Meanwhile, you notice how strange her English is. You barely understand it. You don't recognise her accent.

replies.line: Hey hey...! I don't believe you don't recognise me...! Haha come on let's go get drunk...
Sorry ma'am, I didn't mean to be disrespectful. Could I explain? It's not as it seems...

dialogues.precomment: The girl is about to answer, when a third rough, hoarse voice steps in.
dialogues.line: What the heck is going on here?!
dialogues.comment: A huge man appears. His malevolent scowl directed at her as at you.

dialogues.line: Jeorghe, you're always so dear...
dialogues.comment: she answers back with sarcasm.

dialogues.line: You ugly b...!!
Ha! Watch your tongue...# or you may lose it!
dialogues.comment:
she interrupts him drawing a sharp knife from her belt in an instant.#
Still, she is pointing it at his crotch, not at his tongue.#

Jeorghe growls, very openly suggesting he would try to kill her if he could.#

Then his attention goes back to you.

dialogues.line: Who is this filth??# A prisoner?# No...# There were no men among them...# An intruder! A spy!
dialogues.comment:
He starts laughing wildly,
sounding like an outboard motor who doesn't really want to start.#
He grabs a log almost big as your leg, in order to crack your head open.

dialogues.line: I wouldn't do it, if I were you.
dialogues.comment:
A voice behind you.# You freeze.#
After few paralyzing istants, you slowly turn around, trying to dissimulate your fear.#

The voice belongs to a young woman; she is studying you intently,
head tilted on one side, leaning on one of the carriages.#

She is definitely attractive. She has black glinting eyes, long dark brown hair,
glowing $Rred$C under the light of the torches around.#
She's wearing a wide shirt, quite open on her cleavage.#
As for the rest, she's squeezed in a pair of black, thick, stitched leather leggings.
#Your eyes wonder maybe a little too long on the curve of her left hip protruding outwards,#
since she's leaning with her right elbow on one of the wheels.#

Interesting posture, self confident... with such a delicious narrow waist...##

dialogues.line:
You know? The Chief could express severe disagreement... and heaven knows what he would do to you!
Not to mention what Jeorghe would do to you too...#

With these words she snaps you out of your examining trance, smiling mischievously.#

replies.line: Wai... Wait a second! You won't tell him right? I, erm...!
Rrright! Hey I was just looking... Wait, have we met before?

chapters.text:
$CJeorghe, a mass of muscles, rises his improvised weapon and lunges for you.#

In emergency mode, your brain instantly tells you that you need to act quickly.#
Adrenaline starts pumping through your every vein.#

Where to go, in the middle of a desert?

choices.desc: There's no way you can beat him. Run for your life...!
Fight that thug! Who does he think he is?

chapters.text:
Panicking, you dart away, looking for any kind of cover.#
The brute chases you, smashing everything he ecounters on his path and/or swings.
You slide under the carriages,# then run between the nearest tents...##

It's all useless. He is always one step behind you.#
For one split second you get distracted by the noises he makes, and you turn your head a little to watch him.#
It soon proves to be a mistake.##

Looking over your shoulder like that, you cannot see another man suddenly appearing in front of you.#
He doesn't even try to stop you.# He just stands there with arms crossed letting you stumble and fall to his feet,
like a prey trapped for its hunter.##
You realise you are surrounded.# There's no way out.#

During a few instants, you can observe every detail of his face.#

His devious grin, anticipating with perverse joy what he's about to do.#
His stench, engulfing you as he rushes towards you.#
Time seems to dilate allowing you to count every hateful, alcoholic capillary of his evil eyes.##

You raise your arm, as it could protect you from what it's surely going to happen.##

You raise your fists ready to engage your aggressor.#

During a few instants, you can observe every detail of his face.#

His devious grin, anticipating with perverse joy what he's about to do.#
His stench, engulfing you as he rushes towards you.#
Time seems to dilate allowing you to count every hateful, alcoholic capillary of his evil eyes.##


Then, it's all over in an instant.#
You don't even have the time to think about the absurdity of the very thought of challenging such a brute.#
The strike, so strong, you don't even feel it.##


$dYou should have run.##


-- GAME OVER --##


$DYou just died. You will start again from the last checkpoint. Make wiser choices, traveler.

dialogues.precomment:
Suddenly, a hissing sound wounds the air!#
A flying string appears out of nothing, winding tightly around Jeorghe's chest,#
with stones at its ends which hit him hard when they terminate their spiraling rotation.#

Losing balance, the man falls down on one knee, and lets go of the log.#

Then some kind of $Yshriek$C is heard, and something you can't identify hits the man again, knocking him down,
leaving him growling and wriggling furiously on the ground.##
dialogues.line: Make way, you morons...
dialogues.comment:
you hear the girl from before say as she approached,
breaking into the circle of spectators that has formed.#

Then, everybody backs off, as someone new is arriving.#
You can't see who it is at first, you can only hear an odd jingling sound getting nearer.#

dialogues.precomment:
$CThen,# he steps into the circle.#

You immediately recognise the Chief:#
proud posture,# well-kept hair and beard,# intelligent, disdainful expression,# at times malign,# at times ironic.#
He's tall, more slender than all the other men around.#

He wears several jewelry around his neck,#
and he carries a $cbig sword$C in its sheath and a chain (the source of the jingling) both hanging from his belt.#

He stops a few steps from you, his hands on his hips, observing the scene with curiosity.#
dialogues.line:
What have you guys been up to? Look at you poor little Jeorghe...!#
I think I need to choose better guards for myself!
dialogues.comment: he mocks his man, kicking him a little to tease him.

dialogues.precomment: Jeorghe grunts with unspeakeable wrath:
dialogues.line: Release me! Now!!

dialogues.precomment:
The Chief nods at his men,
#and Jeorghe gets untied and escorted, not withouth any difficulties, somewhere else.
dialogues.line: Who are you? And, please, stand up now...
dialogues.comment: he asks now, gesturing carelessly, and turning abruptly towards you.

dialogues.line: My name is Chris...
dialogues.comment: you answer, after hesitating, just for a moment.

chapters.text:
$M"How come you happen to be here?"$C##

You are not prepared to answer this question.#
You had no chance so far to even think about it.

$c"I.. erm... am from a nearby village.# To the north."# $CYou point with your hand in some random direction.#

$c"And, you know...# I heard about you guys...# What you're doing..."# $CYou try hard to dissimulate your nervousness,#
and to look tough and convincing enough.#

$c"So i told myself I should leave that rat hole,# and go and reach for you and be of help...# To...# The cause...?"#

$c"To be honest sir...# well, I was on my way home yesterday when...#
I was struck by lightnining...# Yeah, and then I woke up outside that village..."
$CYou point somewhere behind you.

$c"After that, not knowing where to go, I just followed your tracks."

$CSomeone in your public had already started chuckling; now almost everybody bursts out.#

You stop talking, you don't know what to expect next.#

The girl is the only one staring seriously at you.

dialogues.line: Enough!
dialogues.comment: Thunders the Chief. Immediately silence falls.

dialogues.line:
You have to agree with me, that's not a great story..." $CHe adds giggling. #
$M"Who do you think might ever believe it?
dialogues.comment:
He draws close to you, examining you head to toes.#
Then he goes back to staring you in the eyes.

dialogues.line: You are no spy. You wouldn't have been so dumb and make all this noise.
dialogues.comment:
He concludes carelessly.#
He looks aside, thoughtful, right hand on his chin, left hand on his right elbow.

dialogues.line: Mmmm... anyway... listen: I am in a good mood today.
dialogues.comment: He snaps his fingers, and draws his face close to yours.

dialogues.line: Here is my proposal: join us!
dialogues.comment:
Immediately a choir of protesting sounds arises.#
Most of the men were hoping to enjoy an execution.#
She remains stoic.

dialogues.precomment: You yourself are surprised.# After a while, not having other choices, you say:
dialogues.line: I'm in for it!

dialogues.precomment: ##The Chief smiles, then turns away quickly and while walking away adds:
dialogues.line:
Corolla: find a place for..."$C he hesitates, as if your name sounds strange to him $M"...Kriss."##

"In the end, two hands may steal more than a mouth can eat...#
dialogues.comment:
and he disappears, snickering.#

She takes you by the arm and leads you away,# under the hateful gazes of the others.

dialogues.precomment:
You walk with Corolla, quick-paced, going somewhere only she knows.#
You see her picking up the bolas that hit Jeorghe, hanging them to her hip...# so it was her saving you!#
Something else attracts your attention though, a movement, in the darkness.#
Unintetionally, you wince. She notices that and says:
dialogues.line: Don't worry. That is Smiurl...
Smiurl...?
dialogues.comment:
You don't understand what she's talking about.#
In the meantime, you unintentionally draw closer to her.

dialogues.line: Yep. It was him to knock Jeorghe down, after I tied him up.

dialogues.precomment: You remember you glimpsed something.# You just weren't thinking that it could be someone.
dialogues.line: Smiurl, don't you think it's time to introduce yourself?
dialogues.comment:
She says after she stopped walking,
apparently talking to the shadows.

dialogues.line: I really have to, haven't I?
dialogues.comment: you hear a squeaky little voice, not distant.

dialogues.line: Well, I guess I have to...
dialogues.comment:
He then adds.#

As if by magic, a little man surfaces out of the shadows. He barely reaches Corolla's waist in height.#
He has a shy look in his eyes.

dialogues.precomment: He stretches up his little wrinkly hand to you and says:
dialogues.line: Hello Kriss, I am Smiurl.
dialogues.comment:
you reciprocate, a little unbelieving. He cannot be just a dwarf.#
He has huge ears, pierced with a plethora of earrings, which jingle faintly when he jolts his head.#
The nose is also quite big, compared to the rest of the face.#
He's wearing a shirt and a pair of short discolored leather trousers.#
His face looks like it's made to constantly display a lost-puppy-like expression...#

dialogues.precomment: Somehow Corolla must know what you are thinking.#
dialogues.line: Don't let him deceive you... Smiurl is a true valiant when you need him.
dialogues.comment:
Hearing that compliment,#
the little guy lits up everywhere.##
$YL$Gi$Wt$Ce$Br$Ma$cl$Yl$Wy.$C## He actually starts emanating a vague, multicoloured luminescence.#

dialogues.line: Whoa!
dialogues.comment: You exclaim, not believing your eyes.

dialogues.line: Easy, he's innocuous!
dialogues.comment: She laughs heartily.# Her laughter rises up, clear and silvery.

dialogues.line: Smiurl is a mutant.
dialogues.comment: She adds right after.

dialogues.line: Incredible...!
dialogues.comment: You observe him, amazed. In the meantime, he has somehow 'turned off'.

dialogues.line: You aren't angry, are you?
dialogues.comment: He asks with trembling voice.

dialogues.line: Angry?! Why would I be angry?
Everybody hates me...# It's because...# I'm different.
dialogues.comment: He complains, looking down.

dialogues.precomment:
You feel compassion for that little man. You can only imagine how miserable his life must be,#
living surrounded by that kind of human filth.# They must make his life a hell every day.#

You say to him warmly:
dialogues.line: I do not hate you! On the contrary: you guys saved my life... and I still haven't thanked you properly!
Our duty.
dialogues.comment:
She smiles openly.# The white of her teeth uncovers under the light of the stars.#

Smiurl starts glowing again, puffing up all happy.

dialogues.precomment:
You keep walking with them for a while.# You start wondering how people like them can mingle with those thugs.#
What are they doing here?#

You reach an area separated from the rest of the encampent by a group of dry trees.#
You see a few tents next to each other.
dialogues.line: There, you can sleep in the tent with Theo.
dialogues.comment: She points at the biggest of the group.

dialogues.line: Who is...
dialogues.comment: You are about to say, but a man is already coming towards you.

dialogues.line:
Precisely. That's him. Theo, let me introduce you to Kriss.#
Would you kindly provide him a bedroll of yours, at least for tonight?
dialogues.comment:
The giant, from the top of his impressive figure, simply answers:#

$B"Of course."##$C and then, to you:# $B"Come."$C#

dialogues.precomment:
You all walk together to his tent.# She keeps it open for you to enter it, Smiurl peeking from behind her legs.#
She looks at you and smiling confidently says:
dialogues.line: Goodnight. With Theo around, no one will dare getting anywhere near here.
Goodnight... And thank you, again!
dialogues.comment: You reply as she disappears into the night, without a sound.

chapters.text:
You stand inside the tent.## Theo,# expressionless,# is looking at you.#
He looks like he's waiting for you to say something.

objects.answer:
The tent is quite big for your standards. But Theo's massive presence makes it look narrow.#
There are few things around. Behind the giant's shoulders you spot a bedroll, a huge backpack, some... weapons?#
But the most striking feature to be observed is Theo himself.

There's some light coming from a lantern on the ground, so you can spend few instants looking at the guy's appearance.#
He's even taller and massive than Jeorghe, and the similarities end there.#
He has ash blonde hair, almost white,# worn in a thick, quite long braid.#
He has a well-kept beard,# not long,# and just a little darker than the rest of his hair,#
which frames his sturdy, squared face.#

His eyes are clear and cold as ice,# still there is something in him softening his gaze...
And his talking,# even if so succint,# wasn't rough, neither veined with hate like those of the other men around there.
The thing Theo just gave you is very simple and basic. You guess it will just have to do.

actions.answer: He keeps on staring at me...

objects.answer: You put the bedroll on the ground, in the area Theo indicated. You fall asleep, too tired and shocked to dream.

condition.refusal: I cannot just lay on the ground.

objects.answer: You put the mat on the ground, in the area Theo indicated. You fall asleep, too tired and shocked to dream.

condition.refusal: I cannot just lay on the ground.

condition.refusal: I cannot just lay on the ground.

objects.answer: He gives you a bedroll and points you to the freer side of the tent.
He gives you a mat and points you to the freer side of the tent.

chapters.text:
##$G<<Kriss...>>$C##

You open your eyes.# You hear that 'voice' again.# Are you imagining it?# Are you going crazy?# Who knows.##

Somehow you feel rested enough.# The tent is now empty, Theo must have left earlier.#

The sun seeps through: it must be quite high already.#
You hear noises coming from the camp. It feels like it's rustling with activity.#
You lay down a little longer, not sure about how you should feel. All of this is just crazy.#
You acted impulsively last night. What are you supposed to do now?##

Well, at least you met Corolla and Smiurl and... Theo...# They seem good persons.#

$c<<The hot girl, the dwarf and the giant. What kind of joke is this??>>$C##

You just can't wrap yuour mind around all of it.# At least, not yet.

choices.desc: You don't know what to do. You need more time to assimilate the rality. You stay in bed to think it through.
No point in helplessly laying down. Better move on and see what's coming next.

dialogues.precomment:
You get up, stretch your limbs and go outside shielding your eyes from the sun with your hand.#

All around, the camp is abuzz. Looking at it in the broad daylight, it reveals itself to be bigger than you thought.#

The majority of the tents has been already packed.#
It's full of men and horses going in all directions more or less hastily.#

In the middle of it all, there is an open jeep. The Chief is standing on its hood, distributing orders here and there.##
dialogues.line: Watch out!
dialogues.comment:
At that sudden sound,# you wince,# to say the least.#
Smiurl comes out from behind a pile of straw.

dialogues.precomment: Noticing your reaction, he istantly assumes a sorry expression, while he starts explaining:
dialogues.line:
It's dangerous...## Corolla ordered me to stand guard and give alarm in case of danger.#
She thinks someone may want to hurt you...##
And she's right.
dialogues.comment: You turn around hearing that baritone voice behind you.

dialogues.line: You'd better get ready.# We'll leave soon.# Wear these.
dialogues.comment:
Theo hands you some clothes.
#It is clear that what you're wearing is not suitable for the journey that awaits you.

dialogues.line: Above all,# take off those shoes...
dialogues.comment:
He then adds looking at your popular sneakers.#
You have to admit they look alien in that place.## You go back to the tent to get changed.

dialogues.precomment:
You are lost in your thoughts...##
Ruminating on what's happening,#
if this is all inside your head,#
if you are still alive,
#and many other good amenities.##

Then a voice abruptly snatches you off your thinking:
dialogues.line: Good morning!
dialogues.comment:
At that sudden sound,# you wince,# to say the least.#
Smiurl is poking whit his head into the tent.# He looks at you with a mixture of cheerfulness and agitation.

dialogues.precomment: Noticing your reaction, he istantly assumes a sorry expression, while he starts explaining:
dialogues.line:
Corolla ordered me to stand guard and give alarm in case of danger.#
She thinks someone may want to hurt you...
And she's right.
dialogues.comment: Theo opens wide the tent around Smiurl in order to let himself inside.

dialogues.line: You'd better get ready.# We'll leave soon.# Wear these.
dialogues.comment:
Theo hands you some clothes.
#It is clear that what you're wearing is not suitable for the journey that awaits you.

dialogues.line: Above all, take off those shoes...
dialogues.comment:
He then adds looking at your popular sneakers.#
You have to admit they look alien in that place.## They both leave you alone to let you change.

chapters.text:
You inspect the clothes Theo gave you.#
A big, heavy pair of combat/trekking boots.#
Wide hat which will covers a substantial part of your face.#
Leather trousers, shirt and a kind of cape, resembling a poncho.##

But waht surprises you is a very heavy mallet.#

$c<<What am I supposed to do with this?>>##$C

You wear the clothes, then look more closely at the big hammer.# You can hardly handle it with just one hand.#
You don't recognise the metallic material it's made of.#
The wider sides are adorned with golden friezes, the shorter fitted with metal spikes.##

First, you wonder in what kind of situation you may need to use it.#
Then you wonder how you could even wield it.##

After few instants, you shake your head and put the mallet down with the other weapons there.#
That thing is not for you.

dialogues.precomment: You just finished changing and examining the hammer, when Corolla steps inside.
dialogues.line: Hi! I see you are ready: good.# It's time to go.
What is this place we are going to...?
The Chief heard about a trade caravan in transit in the valley west from here.

dialogues.precomment:
You stare at her, not understanding what she means.# Maybe you assume an expression a bit stupid.#

Corolla puts her hands onto your shoulders,# transfixing you with her eyes:
dialogues.line: We are going to $Wattack$R them,# Kriss.

chapters.text:
The horde rides swiftly across the plateau.# In the front, the Chief in his jeep.#
Horses loaded with weapons and men form clouds of dust,# galloping spurred by their riders.##

You are in the rearguard,# sharing a horse with Smiurl.# Corolla and Theo are right ahead.#

You never thought riding could be so frustrating.#
You fear that when you'll get back on the ground# (if you will ever do),#
someone will have to very mercifully put all of your pieces back together.#
You feel every jolt in your bones;# your ears are full of the shouts coming from that bunch of...##
You don't even know $Wwhat$C they are.#

And what about Smiurl's own shouts?# Uncomprehensible noise.##


After what it feels like an eternity to you, that mess starts to wane.#
The horses slow down, ending up scattered along the edge of a canyon.#
It quite suddenly cuts everybody off.# A long wound scarring the wide, rocky, semi-desert, plain.#

You watch from the distance the Chief jumping on the hood of the car.#
You couldn't identify the model so far, it must be custom made or heavily customised.#
He starts talking loudly:#

$M"The $Wprey$M will get here shortly after sunset. We'll attack them as fast as lightining,#
and we'll have them defeated before they can even reach out for a spear!"#$C

A roar rises from the rabble.#

$c<<What am I doing among these thugs?>>#$C You go back asking yourself.#
Are you about to witness another slaughter?##

$M"The vanguard and I will hide in that cove;# the rest of you will be lying in wait here and there, on the other side."$C#
He points to the other side of the chasm.#

$M"When you'll see us attack from the front, you'll rush down at break-neck speed,#
possibly making a heck of a noise, and deprive them of any escape route." $CAnd he laughs hard.##

$M"See ya!" $CHe salutes with an happy gesture, as if all of you are about to go for a merry trip to the lake.#
You watch him rumble down the craggy stone wall rising a big cloud of dust,#
followed by a significant number of the men riding horses.

dialogues.precomment: You are still a bit dazed, when Corolla and Theo catch up with you two.
dialogues.line: Did you enjoy the show?
dialogues.comment: She exclaims with sarcasm.

dialogues.line: We need to find shelter.
dialogues.comment: Theo is intently looking around.

dialogues.precomment: You don't understand what's going on.
dialogues.line: What's happening?

It happens that 'a good, healthy battle' is about to start, as the Chief would say.#
But this time, there's something he does not know.#
For too long he had us all dwell in a snake pit...#
And now, he's gonna reap the betrayal he himself sowed.
dialogues.comment: She utters bitterly.

dialogues.precomment:
You still don't understand.#
Somehow your face must make that clear, because Corolla starts again, in a milder tone:
dialogues.line: Many in the horde are tired of his leadership.# Think about Jeorghe: many others here are just like him.
Each of which would gladly take the three... four of us out!
dialogues.comment: Adds Smiurl, who was quiet so far.

dialogues.line:
And not just us; these thugs have an appetite for killing.#
I cannot stand watching any more villages be burnt to the ground.
dialogues.comment: She clenches her fists and her jaw,# embers in her eyes.#

dialogues.line:
Now,# there's no time to explain to you how we ended up with these guys.#
We wanted to warn the Chief about the mutiny plans that are being devised,#
but Jeorghe and his friends prevented us...# Then you arrived out of nowhere...#
Long story short:# all we can do now is hide and hope they won't trouble themselves too much looking for us.

chapters.text:
You are still taking in what Corolla explained to you,# when you reach a cave on the side of the ravine.#
Its access isn't directly visible from where the others are waiting to ambush.#

You prepare to wait.

actions.answer:
The sun is sinking down,# slowly and relentlessly,# anxious and tremulous,#
ready to be swallowed up into night's unfathomed lair,#
giving way to her uncountable shiny emissaries.##

Alien gleams dance on the horizon,# as the strongest rays run the last race,#
darkening on the way and turning the reddish wasteland in a huge tapestry,#
where the armed men are nothing more than maybe-dreamed shapes.

Not the slightest sound disturbs the absolute calm and silence now reigning in the canyon.#
All you can hear is your own blood flowing inside of your ears,#
as well as your heartbeat.#

For all you know,# Theo, Corolla and Smiurl could even have stopped breathing.

The twilight gleam fades away.# Darkness grows thicker.#

At once,# a distant sound.# It must be the caravan you are waiting for.##

Time seems to further slow down its pace.# You can feel the seconds trickle through your fingers as mercury,# liquid,#
painstakingly seeping through and then falling down,# with unbearable slowness,#
almost hesitating,# and,# in the end,# dying on the ground with a thud.

chapters.text:
At once,# you start hearing a distant noise.# It must be the convoy.##

After few more endless minutes spent listening to that noise increase,#
you and the others peek outside.#
Down there are a dozen of big slow transports.# Some of them are pulled by horses, others by motor vehicles.#
They are escorted by many horsemen.##

Without delay, the attack begins.#
Shouts arise in the canyon, echoing countless times on the stone walls, confounding the enemy.#
Then the Chief's roaring jeep charges, suddenly appearing out of its hiding place.#
The entire convoy halts suddenly, and the defensors spread aroud the first chariots.#

The stranglehold works, as the rest of the horde attacks them from their back.#
The noise now saturates the canyon like water in a bottle.#

It's all over very soon.# The attackers are taking out the very last men,# when Corolla says alarmed:#

$R"Wait a second!# What is this noise...??"##
